Inline pathway link

Inline pathway link

Promote pathways to internal and external content within the context of the page.

    On this page
  • Visual design
  • Guidelines for use
  • Layouts

Visual design

The inline pathway can link to either internal site pages.

Linked page title (internal link)

The inline pathway can also link to external sites.

Website name (external link)

CSS styles

Desktop and mobile

Link description
p {
    font-family: OpenSans;
    font-size: 16px;
    color: #333333;
    letter-spacing: 0px;
    line-height: 28px;
}
p:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
}
Link text & icons
.icon {    
    color: #254f90;
    height: 16px;
    width: 16px;
}
a {
    font-size: 12px;
    line-height: 24px;
    text-transform: uppercase;
    text-decoration: none;
    color: #333333;              
}
Container
.container {
    background: #EFF4FB;
    padding: 24px;
    border-top: 4px solid #B3C2D8;
}

View design and assets in Adobe XD.

Guidelines for use

Purpose

The inline pathway provides links related to specific page content.

It can be used singularly within the context of written content if it is a high value step in a process. It can also be used at the end of the page to provide links to explore the subject deeper.

When to use this component.

Coming soon.

Layouts

Page width

Inline pathway components can be used in full width or two-third width pages.

Note: In full width layouts this component is centered on the page with a maximum width of 620px.

Full width layout

Desktop, Tablet & Mobile: One component in a row with zero padding between rows.
